title: Camels and the Pitjantjara
creator_credit: Roger Sandall, Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
brief_description: Shows the daily life of nomadic Central Australian Aborigines of the Pitjantjara tribe who have acquired camels, guns and other modern equipment. Shows the capture of a wild camel and travels in the MacDonnell Range hunting rabbits and living off the land.
creator_credit_for_label: Roger Sandall, Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
